title: In Giant Deals, U.A.E. Got Chips, and Trump Team Got Crypto Riches
content: A lucrative transaction involving the Trump family’s cryptocurrency firm and an agreement giving the Emiratis access to A.I. chips were connected in ways that have not been previously reported.

title: U.S.-China Deal to Avert TikTok Ban May be Close, Trump Official Says
content: Earlier efforts to find a new, non-Chinese owner for the popular video app fell apart. A federal law that cites national security issues requires TikTok owner ByteDance to sell it or face a ban.

title: Nvidia Broke Antitrust Law, China Says, as Tensions With U.S. Mount
content: Chinese regulators, on a day of U.S. trade talks, said that an acquisition by Nvidia had violated antimonopoly regulations.

title: Elon Musk Buys $1 Billion in Tesla Stock as Board Defends His Pay
content: Tesla’s chief executive bought the stock after the company’s board proposed paying him nearly $1 trillion if he achieves certain performance goals.

title: New Crypto Super PAC Garners $100 Million to Help Push Industry Agenda
content: The effort, called the Fellowship PAC, is the crypto industry’s latest move to help elect legislators that will force through its interests in Washington.

title: Lina Khan Revamped Antitrust. Now She’s Pushing the Democratic Party.
content: The youngest chair in the history of the Federal Trade Commission is campaigning for Zohran Mamdani and defending her brand of populism.

title: Used E.V. Sales Take Off as Prices Plummet
content: Electric vehicles on the used market often cost less than comparable gasoline models, making the technology affordable to many more buyers.

title: Tesla Board Chair Defend’s Elon Musk’s Humongous Pay Proposal
content: Robyn Denholm, normally media shy, is campaigning to get shareholders to back the chief executive’s trillion-dollar compensation package.

title: Trump Administration Seeks Pilot Projects for Air Taxis
content: The projects would allow small electric or hybrid aircraft to carry passengers or cargo before federal regulators approve their commercial use.

title: Roblox Sued for Wrongful Death After Teenager’s Suicide
content: At age 7, Ethan Dallas began playing the online game, where he met Nate. Deadly abuse followed, said Ethan’s mother, who blames Roblox.

title: Are We Past Peak iPhone? + Eliezer Yudkowsky on A.I. Doom
content: “There’s only so many things that you can do to redesign a glass rectangle in your pocket.”

title: ‘Civil War’ Mentions Surge Online After Charlie Kirk Shooting
content: The term has increasingly been invoked on social media after major political moments, highlighting divisions among Americans.

title: A.I.’s Prophet of Doom Wants to Shut It All Down
content: Eliezer Yudkowsky has spent the past 20 years warning A.I. insiders of danger. Now, he’s making his case to the public.

title: OpenAI Takes Big Steps Toward Its Long-Planned Reorganization
content: The start-up reached a tentative deal with Microsoft, its biggest investor, and said it would give a $100 billion stake to the nonprofit that manages it.

title: Nepal’s Social Media Ban Backfires as Politics Moves to a Chat Room
content: “The Parliament of Nepal right now is Discord,” a user said of the platform popular with video gamers, where tens of thousands are debating the nation’s future.

title: Wild Speculation and Misinformation on Charlie Kirk Shooting Spreads on Social Media
content: Social media users are spreading elaborate and entirely unsubstantiated theories about what happened to the conservative commentator.

title: F.T.C. Starts Inquiry Into A.I. Chatbots and Child Safety
content: The Federal Trade Commission said it was starting an inquiry of how six major tech companies monitor activity that could harm minors.

title: Their Schools Banned Phones. Out Came the iPods and Cassette Players.
content: Enterprising students have been bringing the contraband of yesteryear to school in what they see as a “loophole” in cellphone bans.

title: Small Businesses Face a New Threat: Pay Up or Be Flooded With Bad Reviews
content: Movers, roofing companies and others are being bombarded with phony one-star reviews on Google Maps. Then they’re asked to pay up.

title: Canadian Man Falsely Named as Charlie Kirk’s Shooter on Social Media
content: The 77-year-old former banker, who lives in Toronto, said he was “shocked” by the speed at which his photograph spread online.

title: Videos of Charlie Kirk’s Shooting Spread Rapidly on Social Media
content: First posted to X, they amassed millions of views on Instagram, Threads, YouTube and Telegram within hours.

title: OpenAI Signs $300 Billion Data Center Pact With Tech Giant Oracle
content: The funding covers more than half of the A.I. data centers that OpenAI plans to build in the U.S. over the next several years.

title: Senators Demand Answers From Mark Zuckerberg on WhatsApp Security
content: Three Republican senators sent a letter to Meta’s chief executive on Wednesday asking him to respond to whistle-blower allegations over security flaws.

title: Royal Ballet and Opera Confronts A.I. With ‘RBO/Shift’ Festival
content: The London institution is creating “RBO/Shift,” a technology festival whose first year will ask how far A.I. can push the boundaries of opera.

title: Why Mark S. Zuckerberg Is Suing Facebook’s Parent Company
content: Facebook has repeatedly flagged his accounts, he says, for “impersonating” the company’s founder, Mark E. Zuckerberg.

title: Apple Introduces iPhone 17, iPhone Air and Updated AirPods at Annual Event
content: The Silicon Valley giant also introduced updates to its traditional smartphones, as well as its AirPods and Apple Watch.

title: Exxon Wants to Make More of the Materials Needed for E.V. Batteries
content: The oil giant said Tuesday that it was acquiring assets from a Chicago company as it looks to start producing graphite, a key battery ingredient, by the end of the decade.

title: United Arab Emirates Joins U.S. and China in Giving Away A.I. Technology
content: The Persian Gulf nation has “open sourced” technology meant to compete with OpenAI and China’s DeepSeek.

title: Nvidia Accuses Rivals of Being A.I. Doomers as US Debates Sale of Chips to China
content: Rankling national security experts, the chipmaker has stepped up attacks on lawmakers who are pushing restrictions.

title: ASML to Invest $1.5 Billion in Mistral, the French A.I. Start-Up
content: ASML, the Dutch maker of semiconductor equipment, is investing about $1.5 billion in Mistral, the French A.I. start-up.

title: US destroys alleged Venezuelan drug boat, killing three
content: The attack came after the Venezuelan president said Caracas would defend itself against US "aggression".

title: DC-style crackdown on crime coming to Memphis, Tennessee, Trump says
content: Trump signs a proclamation establishing a task force to take on crime in the Democrat-led city despite opposition from its mayor.

title: Charlie Kirk suspect linked to crime scene by DNA, says FBI chief
content: Kash Patel says Tyler Robinson's DNA was found on towel wrapping suspected murder weapon.

title: 'Tinder Swindler' con artist arrested in Georgia
content: Israeli Simon Leviev, accused of defrauding multiple women of up to $10m, is taken into custody at an airport.

title: Senate clears Trump pick Miran to  Fed board ahead of key interest rate vote
content: His entry has raised concerns over the Fed's independence, following Trump's bid to reshape the central bank.

title: Spanish PM calls for Israel to be barred from international sport
content: Pedro Sánchez says Israel should be treated in the same way as Russia over its war in Ukraine.

title: Does Israel face a 'South Africa moment' over Gaza?
content: BBC diplomatic correspondent Paul Adams looks at parallels between reactions to Israel and apartheid-era South Africa.

title: Indian billionaire family's private zoo cleared of 'foul play'
content: India's top court had formed a special team to investigate allegations that animals were mistreated at Vantara.

title: US says 'framework' for TikTok ownership deal agreed with China
content: The deal will pave the way to US ownership of the social media platform's American operations, according to the US treasury secretary.

title: Netanyahu does not rule out further strikes on Hamas leaders abroad
content: At a joint press conference with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Netanyahu said every country had the right "to defend itself beyond its borders".

title: Men jailed for witchcraft murder plot against Zambia's president
content: The pair were sentenced to two years in prison after being found with charms, including a chameleon.

title: Watch: Soda truck falls into sinkhole in Mexico City
content: Initial reports suggested the sinkhole was caused by a collapsed drainage system, according to Iztapalapa's mayor.

title: Boss of degrading sex-trade ring in Dubai's glamour districts unmasked by BBC
content: Young Ugandan women tell BBC they are being lured to Dubai to take part in extreme sex acts.

title: Brazil's Lula hits back at Trump over Bolsonaro trial and tariffs
content: In an essay, he says Brazil's democracy and sovereignty "are not on the table" after clashes with the White House.

title: China accuses Nvidia of violating anti-monopoly laws
content: The accusation comes as the US and China hold talks to de-escalate the trade war between the two.

title: India's top court suspends parts of contentious Muslim property law
content: The court refused to strike down the entire law saying "the grant of stay is only in the rarest of rare category".

title: Madeleine McCann suspect refuses Met Police interview
content: Christian Brückner is due to be released from prison in Germany on a separate offence this week.

title: Rising seas will threaten 1.5 million Australians by 2050 - report
content: Australia's first National Climate Risk Assessment predicts more frequent and severe climate hazards.

title: Cash for speeches and big wins for The Pitt and The Studio - Emmys highlights
content: Host Nate Bargatze's plan to keep speeches snappy backfires and political statements take centre stage at the 77th Primetime Emmy Awards.

title: 'My wife died giving birth after Trump cut funding to our clinic'
content: The BBC hears devastating accounts of Afghan mothers and babies dying after US-backed clinics shut.
